com.swoval.files.apple

Class FileEventsApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swoval.files.apple.FileEventsApi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class FileEventsApi
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Provides access to apple file system events. The class is created with two callbacks, one to run when a file event is created and the other to run when the underlying native implementation removes a redundant stream from monitoring. This class is low level and users should generally prefer PathWatcher or ApplePathWatcher if the code is only ever run on OSX.
    See Also:

      • createStream

        public int createStream(java.lang.String path,
                        double latency,
                        int flags)
                 throws FileEventsApi.ClosedFileEventsApiException
        Creates an event stream
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to monitor for events
        latency - The minimum time in seconds between events for the path
        flags - The flags for the stream @see Flags.Create
        Returns:
        handle that can be used to stop the stream in the future
        Throws:
        FileEventsApi.ClosedFileEventsApiException - when the FileEventsApi instance has previously been closed.

        Creates a new FileEventsApi instance
        Parameters:

        pathConsumer - The callback to run when a redundant stream is removed
